data.title: Untitled Document
data.text:
71-740. Reichsarchiv. Schlachten des Weltkrieges: in Einzeldarstellungen Bearbeitet und Herausgeben im Auftrage des Reichsarchivs. Bands 1-36. (38 vols). Complete set. Berlin: Stalling, 1921-1928. 36 Bands in 38 vols Various eds. Band 1: Douaumont 1916; Bd. 2: Karpathen- und Dnjester-Schlacht 1915; Bd. 3: Antwerpen 1914; Bd. 4: "Jildirim" - Deutsche Streiter auf heiligem Boden; Bd. 5: Herbstschlacht in Macedonien, Cernabogen 1916; Bd. 6: Von Nancy bis zum Camp des Romains 1914; Bd. 7 a - b: Die Schlacht bei St. Quentin 1914. I. Teil: Der rechte Flügel der deutschen 2. Armee am 29. u. 30. August; II. Teil: Garde und Hannoveraner vom 28. bis 30. August; Bd. 8: Die Eroberung von Nowo Georgiewsk; Bd. 9: Die Kämpfe um Baranowitschi, Sommer 1916; Bd. 10: Ypern; Bd. 11: Weltkriegsende an der Mazedonischen Front; Band 12 a - b: Der Durchbruch am Isonzo. Teil I: Die Schlacht von Tolmein und Flitsch (24. bis 27 Oktober 1917); Teil II: Die Verfolgung über den Tagliamento bis zum Piave; Bde. 13 - 15: Die Tragödie von Verdun 1916. Teil I: Die deutsche Offensivschlacht; Teil II: Das Ringen um Fort Vaux; Teile III +IV: Die Zermürbungsschlacht - Toter Mann - Höhe 304 / Thiaumont - Fleury; Bd. 16: Der Kampf um die Dardanellen 1915; Bd. 17: Loretto; Bd. 18: Argonnen; Bd. 19: Tannenberg; Bde. 20 - 21: Somme-Nord - Die Brennpunkte der Schlacht im Juli 1916; Bde. 22 -26: Das Marnedrama 1914; Bd. 27: Flandern 1917; Bde. 28 - 29: Die Osterschlacht bei Arras 1917; I. Teil: Zwischen Lens und Scarpe; II. Teil: Zwischen Scarpe und Bullecourt; Bd. 30: Gorlice; Bd. 31: Die Tankschlacht bei Cambrai, 20.-29. November 1917; Bd. 32: Deutsche Siege 1918 - Das Vordringen der 7. Armee über Ailette, Aisne, Vesle und Ourcq bis zur Marne (27. Mi bis 13. Juni); Bd. 33: Wachsende Schwierigkeiten - Vergebliches Ringen vor Compiegne, Villers-Cotterets und Reims; Bd. 34: Der letzte deutsche Angriff; Bd. 35: Schicksalswende. Von der Marne bis zur Vesle 1918; Bd. 36: Die Katastrophe des 8. August 1918. Photos. Folding Maps in pocket. Green composition boards with gilt helmet on front. Cloth spines. Some boards sunned. Very Good Set. $950.00

71-741. Fuller, Claud E. Springfield Muzzle-Loading Shoulder Arms: A Description of the Flintlock Muskets, Musketoons, & Carbines & the Muskets, Musketoons, Rifles, Carbines & Special Models From 1795-1865, With Ordnance Office Reports.& a Sketch of Springfield Armory. Bannerman, 1931. 1931 176p. Photos. Green cloth. Owner's rubber stamp. Oversize. Fine copy. $125

71-742. Marshall, Gen. George C. General Marshall's Report: Winning the War in Europe & the Pacific (Biennial Report of the Chief of Staff of the Army of the Unites States July 1943-June 1945 to the Secretary of War). Simon & Schuster, 1945. 1945 123p. Maps. Text by B.G. Thomas North & Ltc. Paul Carroll & Col. H. M. Pasco. Large Folding. Very Format Red cloth. Spine sunned. Very Good Copy $25

71-743. Cook, D., Illustrated by Lawrence Whipple. Ax Book: Lore & Science of the Woodcutter. Hood, 1999. 1999 134p. Illustrations. Large Wraps. As new copy $15 [ 0911469168 ]

71-744. Diagram Group. Weapons: International Encyclopedia from 5000 B.C. to 2000 A.D. St. Martin's, 1990. 1990 Updated edition. 336p. Illustrations. Oversize. Wraps. Fine copy $18 [ 0911469168 ]

71-745. Anderson, Fred. Crucible of War: Seven Years' War & the Fate of Empire in British North America 1754-1766. Knopf, 2000. 200 3rd ed. 862p. Photos. Maps. Jacket priced. Back panel of jacket rubbed. Heavy. Fine/Near Fine copy $50 [ 0312039506 ]

71-746. Rankin, Col. Robert. Uniforms of the Army. Putnam's, 1967. 1967 126p. b/w Photos. Color plates by Charles McBarron. Pictorial cover. Ex.lib. rubber stamps. Pocket. Not soiled. Very Good Copy $35

71-747. Lorain, Pierre Les Armes Americaines 1870-1871 de la Defense Nationale. Paris: L'Emancipat Rice, 1970. 1970 96p. Line Drawings. American Small Arms of the Civil War Era used in the Franco-Prussian War. Pictorial cover. Large format. Fine copy $45

71-748. Reinfeld, Fred. Story of Civil War Money. Sterling, 1959. 1959 93p. b/w Photos. Near Fine/Very Good Copy $18

71-749. Romanus & Sutherland. Stilwell's Command Problems. United States Army in World War II. GPO, 1985. 1985 Reprint of 1956. 518p. Photos. Maps. Map in pocket. Green Cloth. Fine Copy $35

71-750. Clarke & Smith. Riviera to the Rhine. United States Army in World War II. GPO, 1993. 1993 1st ed. 605p. Photos. Maps. Green cloth. Principally 7th Army operations. As New Copy $125

71-751. Stevens, Kent & Leonard (ed). Papers of Henry Bouquet. Vol. II. The Forbes Expedition. Pennsylvania Historical & Museum Commission, 1951. 1951 704p. Photos. Some folding usually of maps. Black cloth. Fine copy $100

71-752. Peters, Virginia. Florida Wars. Archon, 1979. 1979 1st ed. 331p. Photos. Maps. Covers period 1810-1858. SIGNED & inscribed. Near Fine/Very Good copy $80 [ 0375406425 ]

71-753. Graham, Col. W.A. Reno Court of Inquiry: Abstract of the Official Record of Proceedings, Chicago 13 January 1879, Upon the Request of Major Marcus A, Reno 7th Cavalry to Investigate His Conduct at the Battle of Little Bighorn, 25-26 June 1876. Stackpole, 1954. 1954 NAP. 303p. Folding Map. Owner's name. Jacket chipped. Near Fine/Very Good copy $45

71-754. Pogue, Forrest. George C. Marshall: Organizer of Victory 1943-1945. Viking, 1973. 1973 1st ed. 683p. Maps. Heavy. Fine/Very Good Copy $35

71-755. James, Alfred (ed). Writings of General John Forbes Relating to His Service in North America. Unigraphic, 1975. 1975 Reprint of 1938. 316p. Photos. Black cloth. Fine copy $45

71-756. Roads, C. H. British Soldier's Firearm 1850 -1864. R&R, 1994. 1994 1st thus. 332p. Photos. "From Smoothbore to Small bore" As New/As New copy $75 [ 0208017194 ]

71-757. Johnson, Stanley. Queen of the Flat Tops: USS Lexington & Battle of Coral Sea. Dutton, 1942 4th ed. 280p. Photos. Jacket rubbed, marginal tears. Near Fine/Fair Copy $15

71-758. Blair, Clay. Ridgway's Paratroopers: American Airborne in World War II. Dial, 1985. 1st. ed. 588p. Maps & Photos. Heavy. Jacket priced. Jacket in brodart. Fine/Near Fine copy $35 [ 188484913x ]

71-759. Alexander, Col. Joseph. Utmost Savagery: Three Days of Tarawa. Naval Institute, 1995. 1st ed. 304p. Maps. Photos. Fine/Near Fine Copy $40 [ 0385278888 ]

71-760. Ridgway, Gen Matthew. Soldier: Memoirs of Matthew Ridgway. Harper, 1956. 1st. ed. 371p. CG 82d Airborne & XVIII Airborne Corps in WW II, Later Army Chief of staff. Jacket spine sunned. Price clipped. Jacket in brodart. Fine/Near Fine Copy $60

71-761. US Army German Campaign in Russia: Planning & Operations 1940-1942. Historical Study DA Pam 20-261A. German Report Series. GPO, 1978. Reprint of 1955. 187p. Folding maps. Gray Wraps. Near Fine copy $22

71-762. Wheeler, Maj. William. Road to Victory: History of Hampton Roads/ Port of Embarkation in World War II. Newport News, 1946. 2 vols. 316p+ 380 Photos. Maps. Black cloth. Near Fine set $70

71-763 Sontag & Drew. Blind Man's Bluff: The Untold Story of American Submarine Espionage. Public Affairs, 1998. NAP. 352p. Photos. Line drawings. Owner's emboss. Jacket priced. Fine/Fine copy $10 1891620088

71-764 Lambeth, Benjamin. NATO's Air War for Kosovo: A Strategic and Operational Assessment. Rand Corp, 2001. 276p. Photos. Large Wraps. 2 pages highlighted. Very Good copy $12 0833030507

71-765 Tangredi, Sam. Futures of War: Toward a consensus View of the Future Security Environment 2010-2035 Alidade, 2008. 273p. Large Wraps. Fine copy $12 9781436310246

71-766 Manson, M. P. Guns, Mortars and Rockets. Land Warfare Brassey's New Battlefield Weapons Systems Series & Technology into the 21st Century Series. Vol. 3. Brassey's, 1997. Rev. ed. 163p. Photos. Line drawings. Pictorial covers. About 35 pages highlighted. Very Good copy $25 1857531728

71-767 Smith, Carl. Pearl Harbor. Osprey, 2001 1st ed. 96p. Photos. Color Maps. Wraps. CD ROM present. Fine copy $15 1841764248

71-768 Shulimson, Blasiol, Smith & Dawson. U.S. Marines in Vietnam: Defining Year 1968. GPO, 1997. 805p. Maps. Photos. Oversize. Wraps. Fine Copy $150 0160491258

71-769 Solis, LTC Gary. Marines & Military Law in Vietnam: Trial by Fire. GPO, 1989. 295p. Photos. Oversize. Damp rippling to lower edged. Near Fine/Near Fine Copy $55

71-770 Carell, Paul. Unternehmen Barbarossa Im Bild: Der Russlandkrieg, Fotografiert von Soldaten.. Ullstein, 1978. 465p. Photos. Some in color. Heavy. Near Fine/Very Good copy $47 3550060564

71-770 Schecter, Barnet. Battle for New York: City at the Heart of the American Revolution. Walker, 2002. 1st ed. 454p. Photos. Fine/Near Fine copy $25 0802713742

71-771 Fall, Bernard. Street Without Joy: Indochina at War 1946-54. Stackpole, 1961. 2d ed. 322p. Maps, Photos. Small unit combat in French Indo-China. Yellow cloth. Near Fine Copy. $100

71-772 Wilson, John. Armies, Corps, Divisions & Separate Brigades. Army Lineage Series. GPO, 1987. 1st ed. 736p. color plates of distinctive insignia. Blue cloth Oversize. Fine Copy $50

71-773 Sheffield & Bourne (ed). Douglas Haig: War Diaries and Letters 1914-1918. Weidenfeld & Nicolson, 2005. 1st ed. 550p. Photos. Heavy. As New/As New copy $50 0297847023

71-774 Pargellis, Stanley (ed). Military Affairs in North America 1748-1765: Selected Documents from the Cumberland Papers in Windsor Castle. Archon, 1969 514p. Photos. Fine/Near fine copy $225

71-775 Albert, Alphaeus. Record of American Uniform & Historical Buttons 1775-1976. Bicentennial Edition.. Hightstown, 1977. Bicentennial Ed. (18th printing). 511p. Photos. Blue cloth. Fine copy $90

71-776 Fraccaroli Aldo. Marina Militare Italiana 1946. Albertelli, 1994 208p. Photos. Illustrations. A "jane's" of the Italian navy in WW II. Wraps. Fine copy $25 8885909965

71-777 Lipscomb & Davies. Up She Rises: Story of Naval Salvage. Hutchinson, 1966 1st ed. 264p. Photos. Black cloth. Ex.lib. Number on spine, pocket. Rubber stamps. Sound. Spine a bit silverfished. Good copy $20

71-778 Rhades, Jurgen. Die Deutsche marine in Vergangenheit und Gegenwart. Kohler, 1968 224p. Photos. Color plates of flags. Wraps. Ex.lib. Very Good copy $15

71-779 Lanard, Capt. Thomas. History of the Infantry Battalion State Fencibles of Philadelphia Pennsylvania & Gate City Guard of Atlanta GA and its Peaceful Invasion of the North 1879 Unveiling of the Peace Monument at Atlanta 1911. 199p. Photos. Red cloth. Heavily silverfished. Interior clean. Poor copy $12

71-780 Rheinmetall. Handbook on Weaponry. Bronners, 1982 2nd English Ed. 752p. Photos. Line drawings. Ballistics. Wraps. Fine copy $35

71-781 Lord, Carnes (ed). Reposturing the Force: U.S. Overseas Presence in the Twenty-First Century. Naval War College Newport Papers 26. Naval War College P., 2006 194p. Wraps. Fine copy $15

71-782 Vego, Milan. Major Naval Operations. Naval War College Newport Papers 32. Naval War College P., 2008 141p. . Wraps. Fine copy $15

71-783. Rice, Rondall. Politics of Air Power: From Confrontation to Cooperation in Army Aviation Civil-Military Relations. Univ. Nebraska P., 2004. NAP. 293p. Owner's name. Fine/Fine Copy $15 0803239602

71-784 Coletta, Paola. Patrick N.L. Bellinger and U.S. Naval Aviation. Univ. Pr. of America, 1987. 467p. Photos. Green cloth. Owner's name. Fine Copy $95 0819165344

71-785 Trimble, William. Hero of the Air: Glenn Curtiss and the Birth of Naval Aviation. Naval Institute, 2010. 2nd ed. 270p. Photos. New/New Copy $22 9781591148791

71-786 Till, Geoffrey. Air Power and the Royal Navy 1914-1945: A Historical Survey. Macdonald and Jane's, 1979. 1st ed.224p. Photos. Owner's name. Fine/Fine Copy $30 0354012045

71-787 Wilson, Eugene. Slipstream: Autobiography of an Air Craftsman. McGraw, 1965. 2nd ed. 366p. Development of aviation, esp. naval aviation between 1924-1950. Fine/Good copy $15 No isbn

71-788 Lowenthal, Mark. Intelligence: From Secrets to Policy. CQ Press (Congressional Quarterly), 2000. 1st ed. 264p. How the intelligence community's history, structure, procedures, and functions affect policy decisions. Wraps. Fine copy $15 1568025122

71-789 Arkin, William. Divining Victory: Airpower in the 2006 Israel-Hezbollah War. Air University/GPO, 2007. 326p. Photos. Maps. Large Wraps. Fine copy $25 9781585661688

71-790 Miller, John. Men & Volts at War: Story of General Electric in World War II. Whittlesey, 1947. 2nd ed. 272p. Photos. Tan cloth. Fine copy $18 No isbn

71-791 Rose, Joseph. American Wartime Transportation. Crowell, 1953. NAP. 290p. Covers Railroads, highways & air modes. Economic analysis. Yellow cloth. Near Fine copy $45 No isbn

71-792 Campbell, Lt. Gen. Levin. Industry-Ordnance Team. Whittlesey, 1946 NAP. 461p. Photos. Maps. Campbell was US Army chief of Ordnance during World War II. Blue cloth. Very Good copy $50 No isbn

71-793 Raeder, Grand Adm. Erich. My Life. Da Capo, 2001 1st Thus. 430p. Photos. Chief of German Navy in early WW II. Large Wraps. As new copy $18 0306809621

71-794 Lynn, John (ed). Coming to the Americas: Eurasian Military Impact on the Development of the Western Hemisphere. Norfolk, 2002. International Commission of Military History, 2003. 1st ed. 452p. 33 papers in English, French, Spanish & German. Each paper in only one language. Covers 15th to 20th Centuries. Large wraps. As New Copy $15 1890093130

71-795 Mandeles, Hone, C & Terry. Managing 'Command and Control' in the Persian Gulf War. Praeger, 1996. 1st ed. 170p. Blue cloth. Fine copy $35 0275952614

71-796 Kaufmann, J. E.& Kaufmann, H. W. Sleeping Giant: American Armed Forces Between the Wars. Praeger, 1996 1st ed. 216p. Red cloth. Fine copy $75 0275952568

71-797 Bryan Lcdr J. & Reed. Mission Beyond Darkness. Duell, 1945 1st ed. NAP. 133p. Photos. Endpaper maps. Naval air strike at dusk during the Battle of the Philippine Sea June 19 1944. USS Lexington's Air Group 16. Black cloth. Small white smudge on front cover. Near Fine Copy $45 No isbn

71-798 Somers, Herman. Presidential Agency OWMR: Office of War Mobilization & Recovery. Harvard, 1950. Nap. 238p. Jacket in brodart. Fine/Very Good Copy $20 No isbn

71-799 Stout, Wesley. Great Engines and Great Planes. Chrysler, 1947. 133p. Photos. Black cloth. Story of Chrysler aircraft production during WWII. Fine copy $15 No isbn

71-800 Stout, Wesley. Mobilized. Chrysler, 1949. 216p. Photos. Illustrations. Story of Chrysler engineering during WWII. Black cloth. Ex.lib. front cover had masking tape pulled off .Fair copy $5 SOLD

71-801 Stout, Wesley. A War Job Though Impossible. Chrysler, 1945. 51p. Photos. Illustrations. Chrysler Gyroscope production in WW II. Poor copy $5 No isbn

71-802 Stout, Wesley. Great Detective. Chrysler, 1946. 99p. Photos. Illustrations. Story of Chrysler radar production during WWII. Green cloth. Fine copy $15 No isbn
